intro: Pinalia muscicola, commonly known as the musk moss, is a unique species of moss belonging to the family Pinnataceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and dark green, velvety foliage. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories or on rocky substrates. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on short, upright stalks and release spores when mature. Pinalia muscicola plays a vital role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its native habitats.
